title: Quick Start doc - Start developing not working with yarn
body:
Quick start with yarn does not work (yet?)

steps tried

1. npx degit redwoodjs/sdk/starters/standard rwsdk-one
2. cd rwsdk-one
3. yarn install
- fails
- need to remove packageManager line in package.json
- yarn install
- completes ok
4. yarn dev
- fails
- Project has no .wrangler directory yet, assuming fresh install: running `pnpm dev:init`...
4. yarn dev:init
- ok
5. yarn dev
- fails
- ExecaError: Command failed with exit code 1: pnpm wrangler types


It appears that pnpm is hard-coded. Consider putting note in Getting Started doc that yarn is not working at this time.
author: rkmitra1

comments.body: Weird, I swear I tested this a few days ago. I'll take a look again.
@peterp there were some remaining ones it seems, fixing in #297 and will test out replacing with yarn in standard starter after that's released.
Thank you @rkmitra1. We've removed the last remaining places where we were referencing `pnpm`. I tested out the standard starter with yarn and works now. You should be good to go now.

Works for me now. Thanks.

FYI. This is i just a peculiarity of my yarn set up, but i have to remove pnp files and add .yarnrc.yml file, delete yarn.lock.

then
1. yarn install
2. yarn dev
Works :)

satisfaction_conditions: Ability to use yarn instead of pnpm with the RedwoodJS SDK starter
Working development environment setup process with yarn
Removal of pnpm-specific references in the codebase
